channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: Mailbox-style readers. https://t.co/NFU8GjV0HC

If you don‚Äôt believe we‚Äôre a racist country, tell me when people of color ever tried to stop white people from voting.
This was poorly worded. I suppose it's inevitable that at some time some person of color did try to stop a white person from voting. But if you give a snarky answer, that makes you look like an ass -- and I'll just block you instead of trying to prove to you that you're an ass.

@AdamSinger @SubstackInc @hamishmckenzie @lulumeservey It's easily solved. I did raise the issue, but basically there was no response. They just have to support inbound RSS feeds. I would help them do it.

@AdamSinger @SubstackInc @hamishmckenzie @lulumeservey I would‚Äôve used substack for my nightly emails, but I would‚Äôve had to retype all my words into their editor. I‚Äôm allergic to that kind of lock-in. Had to write my own software.
Debouncing and Throttling Explained Through Examples. https://t.co/xUMdxZVBTC
Traffic Stop. The most powerful ad. https://t.co/iy1g2Pbxxq
@rebirth_of_slic @thenation @ElieNYC I guess this is supposed to be a joke.

Of course the whole thing about the election workers was about race. It was a 2021 version of a lynching.
terrorism.
the president of the country was using all his power to terrorize the country.
like 9/11 but an inside job.
and while racism is still built into the fabric of the country, we've had over 50 years of the Great Society and Brown v Board, and Obama as president, that has changed the country enough so that we can see the terrorism for what it is.
we are the same people, all americans, and when you terrorize people based on the color of their skin, we all feel the terror because we know we're the same people, americans.
doc rivers, a famous NBA coach, put it so well.
"we keep loving this country and this country doesn‚Äôt love us back.‚Äù
the proper answer to the terrorism is love.
https://t.co/DXHfIh18Ez
@jeffjarvis @craignewmark I grew up in Queens, and as such would never consider anything but cheese, maybe pepperoni or sausage, and that‚Äôs about it. Pineapple? No thank you. üçï
Tesla Is Forcing the Auto Industry to Rethink How It Sells Cars. https://t.co/jgM754LkXv
A word I haven‚Äôt heard used re Jan 6 and the events leading up to it: terrorism.
Knicks fans, who would you trade IQ for?
I don‚Äôt want to embarrass anyone, but I just got QT‚Äôd by a famous actor. üòÄ https://t.co/NALm9knqut
@berzerkeley Thank you, from a friendly remindee in New York. ;-)
Wordle 367 4/6 ‚¨ú‚¨ú‚¨ú‚¨ú‚¨ú ‚¨úüü®‚¨úüü®‚¨ú ‚¨úüü®‚¨ú‚¨ú‚¨ú üü©üü©üü©üü©üü©
Why not just use the open web. https://t.co/8rbtovdN6L
I wonder if Lincoln had not been assassinated if he would have done Reconstruction without also limiting the Electoral College and Senate advantage of the Confederate states.

Twitter to expand into long-form content with upcoming Twitter Notes feature. https://t.co/b2ratgIMCf
I think this is what I‚Äôve been waiting for, for a decade.
I don't understand why the #knicks want to trade anything. They have such an outstanding group of young players. Maybe they won't all be stars, but there's a lot of potential there.
House Democrats Have Unified as Never Before. https://t.co/F6C8mjn8lf
Watching the Jan 6 hearing. It's really embarrassing that there is no cross-examination.
Dear #toolsforthought friends --> outlines in feeds. https://t.co/N1ykHrI10T This is going to be interesting. :-)

I think we should encourage the states that want to secede to do so. Then when they want to come back into the union, the price is they give up their electoral vote advantage and their senate seats. No more tail wagging the dog. yes i know this is not practical. ;-)
it seems that's what should have happened after the civil war. abolish the senate and electoral college, those were structurally supporting slavery, that's why we never really got past slavery. it's the same fight generation after generation. are black people slaves.
i've learned so much from reading books about slavery in the last two years, that's all i've been reading.
but if you want to get it in a quick read -- get @ElieNYC's book. it's a fire hose of perspective on what the US is about, constitutionally.
https://t.co/ML9dkpX7Il

In the early days of blogging we called this "Sources go direct." https://t.co/5G0ZgTwiBV
If we had a way of communicating with Democrats the breakthrough could have come from progressives instead of a fascist.
It's weird because we were celebrated at the 2004 DNC. They had parties for us. But they didn't listen.
@jeffjarvis They're both server errors. It means something broke in their CMS.
